title: React Front End Developer
text: ROLE Payment Data Systems is seeking a talented front end React engineer for our Austin, TX office. Applicant must reside in the Austin Metro area to be considered for this role. TEAM You’ll join our Akimbo team where great experiences are at the heart of everything we do. Akimbo is an innovative debit card product that makes sharing money, managing allowances and keeping to a budget, fun, engaging and simple. We’re geeks who are excited by using new technology but are even more excited by inventing it ourselves. Our environment offers many opportunities to experiment, share ideas and make a huge impact on the cardholder experience. TECHNOLOGY We’ve developed and operate the full card issuing and processing stack which offers unique flexibility and agility to release new innovative features, often giving us a first-to-market advantage. We are one of the first prepaid cards to offer contactless payments and the only to offer it for gift cards We also offer an incentive and reward card product for businesses which offers real-time delivery through the use of virtual card technology. Our front end mobile and web applications are a mix of React and Angular. ENVIRONMENT Want to work with us? Our environment is casual, friendly and fun. We work hard, but believe in a work-life balance that means you aren’t spending long hours in the office everyday as long as you’re meeting your goals. EXPECTATIONS As a React front end engineer, you’ll be expected to create engaging user experiences. You'll translate designs into consumer-facing responsive web applications. You’ll integrate with our Rest APIs and other 3rd-party services. You’ll collaborate with designers, account representatives and other stakeholders in brainstorming new ideas, developing features, gathering feedback and iterating, thereby continuously providing impactful improvement to our products. REQUIRED EXPERIENCE 2+ years of experience with React 2+ years of experience translating designs into consumer-facing responsive web applications 1+ years of experience with Git Must reside in Austin Metro Area PREFERRED EXPERIENCE 2+ years of experience with React Native 1+ years of experience with SAAS or LESS 1+ years of experience with Gulp or Grunt 1+ years of experience with Yarn, Bower or npm 1+ years of experience with vector SVGs or font icons Bachelor's degree in Computer Science BENEFITS Eligible for two weeks of vacation per year Subsidized health and dental insurance 401(k) employer matching Annual training allowance ABOUT PDS Payment Data Systems (NASDAQ: PYDS), is a leading integrated payment solutions provider and prepaid program manager and offers a wide range of payment solutions to merchants, billers, banks, service bureaus, and card issuers. title: Front-End Developer (.Net Developer)
text: Company Description Infotree Global Solutions: Leading Staffing Agency. Job Description ONLY W2 AND LOCAL CANDIDATES Title: Front-End Developer Duration: 12+ Months Location: Louisville, KY If Interested, Please reach out to me directly at kajal@infotreeglobal.com or 734-928-2457 Job Description: LONG TERM ASSIGNMENT WITH OPPORTUNITY TO EXTEND BUT CANNOT BE GUARANTEED Schedule: Mon-Fri, 8am-5pm DRESS CODE: Business Casual Phone screens and in person interviews will be conducted Parking will not be reimbursed, candidate must pay for parking This role is responsible for creating client-side web solutions to meet business needs and objectives with an end goal of providing a seamless experience for our end-users. Candidates in the role should show proficient knowledge in HTML, JavaScript, and CSS as well as possess the skills necessary to work in a collaborative environment with business, design, and IT partners. Responsibilities Create semantic, W3C valid, accessible, cross-browser compatible front-end web pages, components, and websites. Create, maintain, and implement loosely-coupled, modular JavaScript solutions. Act as a consultant to an agency, vendor, IT, or the Digital IT team to ensure projects are semantic, W3C valid, accessible (as required), and cross-browser compatible. Deliver subject matter expertise within the realm of integrating front-end technologies with back-end systems, MVC patterns, and third-party services. Work within current constraints of a pre-existing website or application to extend functionality or support User-Experience (Design) direction. Work in a Scrum/Agile type environment and deliver upon assigned work in a timely manner over the course of an iterative project time-table. Be available for execution or support of production turns. Troubleshoot and resolve issues, problems, and errors encountered across our web properties, internal applications, and systems as reported or experienced. Provide expertise to influence project, initiative, and maintenance technical direction during discovery, planning, and implementation stages. Maintain modern development standards with best-practice approaches to front-end coding and development processes. Stay current on industry trends and knowledge and utilize the information to guide the team. Provide post-launch verification of features and changes. Ensure and maintain an expected level of accessibility in our applications. Ensure design parity to provided comps while still meeting development and accessibility standards. title: Front-End Engineer
text: Your work will help people stay connected. Call-Em-All helps people communicate valuable information to their organization. Every month, millions of important phone calls and text messages are sent using our web-based applications. With a focus on great customer experiences and a strict responsible use policy, we help our customers deliver messages that people actually want and need. Picture important messages to employees, students, or congregations and not marketing or political messages. Our culture. We are a small tight-knit team, so you'll get a chance to wear many hats and directly impact the direction and success of Call-Em-All. As our company grows, many different opportunities, experiences, and challenges will present themselves. You'll work with a team that believes that success is measured by more than the bottom line, but we do maintain a healthy bottom line, too. Our company is self-funded and a proud member of the Small Giants community. Want to know what we believe in? Read Our Manifesto (https://www.call-em-all.com/manifesto) Call-Em-All is the proud recipient of the following awards: Dallas Business Journal Best Places to Work 2014 & 2016, Inc Magazine Best Workplaces 2017, Best Companies to Work for in Texas 2018, Forbes Best Small Companies in America 2018 Front-End Engineer We'll expect you to learn quickly and make critical and significant contributions. Currently, we're focused on a new react native mobile app, enhancing our customer-facing web application, and expanding our texting solutions. We're looking for someone who values product design and knows how to deliver a great user experience. We'll also count on you to share your knowledge and experience to grow those around you. We often form smaller cross-functional teams organized around a particular problem or feature. As a front-end engineer, your role includes understanding the problem, designing and implementing a solution, deployment, testing, and measuring success. You'll see the impact of your work in our weekly Scoreboard meeting, where the entire company reviews our key metrics and initiatives. You'll hear from, and work with, our customer experience team to resolve issues and continue to improve our product. We love new ideas and embrace healthy conflict. You won't be forced to attend countless soul-draining status meetings or report to three different managers. We'll empower your creativity and stay out of the way so you can make us better. You'll be an integral part of a small engineering team that's passionate about building great software. But don't just take our word for it, feel free to check out our contribution to the open-source community by visiting material-ui.com. We organize a monthly Meetup group called ReactJS Dallas. If you're in the DFW area, come check it out and meet us in person! We also host a free bi-weekly coder dojo to help local kids learn about technology. Requirements: Proficiency in Javascript, HTML, CSS skills Extensive knowledge of React Experience consuming RESTful APIs Experience building single-page applications Working knowledge of flux architecture (we are using Redux) Comfortable with Git Passionate about writing great software Lifelong learner Work from our office in Frisco, TX Bonus points if you have: Built native iOS or Android apps Worked with React Native Worked with Material-UI or similar UI framework Experience deploying apps to AWS or Heroku Working knowledge of CI/CD solutions Experience with relational databases, ability to write SQL queries Built web APIs with node.js If you're interested, we'd love to see your work. It could be anything from a side project or your GitHub profile Why Call-Em-All? Our purpose: To have a positive impact on those around us Named one of Forbes Magazine's 25 Best Small Businesses for 2018 Recipient of local, state, and national Best Place to Work awards Proud Member of the Small Giants and Tugboat communities of values-driven companies Benefits Profit-Sharing Health/Dental/Vision Insurance (100% of premiums paid) 100% 401k match on 6% of your salary, immediately vested Group Life & Disability Insurance Flexible Vacation Policy Paid cell phone service with new phone allowance every two years Paid gym memberships or equivalent Casual dress (we want you to be comfortable) Endless learning possibilities Fully stocked kitchen with drinks and snacks Jedi ping pong training Continuing education budget Flexible work hours Sit/stand desks Matching charitable contributions to 501c3 Community involvement programs Working with great people lUkByGdAze

title: Front End Engineering Manager / Lead
text: About us: Here at Pex, we've built the largest audio-visual search engine in the world providing creators, musicians, and rights holders with the platform and ability to understand the usage of their content, expose their content to wider audiences, and make more money in the process. Headquartered in Downtown Los Angeles with offices in Boulder and Prague, we are a rapidly expanding team looking for an experienced Front End Engineering Manager / Lead to join and grow along with us! Our stack: Our stack is very complex - it spans tens of thousands of servers and trillions of rows of data. Take a peek at the links below for a clearer understanding: https://softwareengineeringdaily.com/2018/06/22/video-search-with-rasty-turek/ https://cloud.google.com/customers/pex/ https://www.citusdata.com/customers/pex On the front-end, we use TypeScript, React, Mobx, jest, cypress, and enzyme, and on the backend it's a mix of Go, Java, C/C++ and a few others. For data we primarily use PostgreSQL (horizontally distributed by Citus) and FoundationDB, and we have an extensive CI/CD pipeline split between Jenkins and Drone. Role: Build and manage an engaged, high performing team of Frontend Engineers through technical leadership, mentorship, performance management, and goal setting. Own the code management process including sprints & deployments. Help put processes and documentation in place to improve communication with the broader product team. Work closely with product management and design to represent the Front end team in product discussions and decisions Contribute to the Frontend stack by providing code and architecture reviews, and triaging production issues. Identify new frameworks and libraries that can help to simplify our code and enhance user experience. Our ideal candidate has: Solid knowledge of Javascript, TypeScript, and React Experience leading / managing a team of engineers for career development, performance, commitments, and sprints Experience implementing software development best practices for code management, continuous integration, and automated testing Experience architecting and building scaleable frontend web solutions An obsession with user experience The ability to work on-site in our DTLA office Prior experience managing distributed teams (huge plus!) Benefits: A supportive culture that cares about both excellent work and work-life balance Salary & equity, with perks like a 10-year exercise window Competitive health insurance (99% employee and 70% dependent premium coverage) $300/month to spend on commute or office/co-working space 90 days of paid parental leave 30 days of PTO Pex is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company.
